course.title: End-to-End Data Science and AI Engineering Roadmap: From Beginner to Job-Ready
course.description: This comprehensive, sequential roadmap is designed for complete beginners to become job-ready Data Scientists and AI Engineers. It aligns with industry standards, incorporating foundational skills, core data science techniques, advanced AI methodologies, practical projects, and ethical considerations. The curriculum spans approximately 12-18 months of dedicated study, assuming 10-15 hours per week, and emphasizes hands-on learning with Python as the primary language.
course.targetAudience: Complete beginners with no prior experience in programming or math beyond high school level.
overallObjectives: Master foundational programming, math, and statistics for data manipulation and analysis.
Build proficiency in machine learning, deep learning, and AI model development.
Develop skills in data engineering, deployment, and ethical AI practices.
Complete portfolio-worthy projects to demonstrate job-ready competencies.
course.assessmentApproach: Combination of quizzes (20%), problem sets/DPPS (30%), projects (40%), and capstone evaluation (10%). Passing criteria: 70% overall, with no module below 60%.
toolsAndTechnologies: Python (NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch)

modules.name: Foundations of Programming and Mathematics
modules.description: Build essential programming skills and mathematical foundations required for data science and AI. This module ensures learners can handle code and understand underlying algorithms.
learningObjectives: Write and debug basic Python programs for data manipulation.
Apply linear algebra, calculus, and probability concepts to data problems.
Understand statistical measures for data interpretation.

topics.name: Introduction to Programming with Python
learningObjectives: Install and set up Python environment.
Write scripts using variables, loops, functions, and conditionals.
Handle data structures like lists, dictionaries, and tuples.

projects: Build a simple calculator app using Python functions.
problemSets: 10 exercises on loops and data structures (e.g., fizzbuzz, list comprehensions).
quizzes: Multiple-choice quiz on Python syntax (20 questions).

assessmentCriteria: Correct output for all test cases (30%)

topics.name: Mathematics for Data Science
learningObjectives: Solve linear equations and matrix operations.
Apply calculus concepts like derivatives for optimization.
Use probability distributions to model uncertainty.

subtopics.name: Linear Algebra
subsubtopics: Applications in PCA and dimensionality reduction

subtopics.name: Calculus and Probability
subsubtopics: Probability basics: Bayes' theorem, distributions (normal, binomial)

projects: Implement matrix multiplication from scratch in Python.
problemSets: 20 problems on vector operations and probability calculations.
quizzes: Quiz on linear algebra applications (15 questions).

topics.name: Statistics Fundamentals
learningObjectives: Compute descriptive statistics for datasets.
Perform hypothesis testing to validate assumptions.
Interpret correlation and regression basics.

projects: Analyze a dataset for statistical summaries using Python.
problemSets: 15 exercises on hypothesis testing with sample data.
quizzes: Statistics quiz covering distributions and tests (25 questions).

modules.name: Data Manipulation and Analysis
modules.description: Learn to collect, clean, explore, and visualize data using industry-standard tools. Focus on transforming raw data into actionable insights.
learningObjectives: Query databases using SQL.
Clean and preprocess datasets with Pandas.
Create visualizations to communicate findings.

topics.name: SQL for Data Querying
learningObjectives: Write complex SQL queries for data extraction.
Join tables and aggregate data.
Optimize queries for large datasets.

projects: Query a sample e-commerce database to generate sales reports.
problemSets: 20 SQL problems on joins and aggregations.

topics.name: Data Wrangling with Pandas and NumPy
learningObjectives: Handle missing data and outliers.
Perform data transformations and feature engineering.
Work with multi-dimensional arrays.

projects: Clean and preprocess a Kaggle dataset for analysis.

topics.name: Data Visualization
learningObjectives: Create static and interactive plots.
Design dashboards for stakeholder communication.
Choose appropriate chart types for data stories.

projects: Build a sales dashboard using Tableau on a dataset.

modules.name: Machine Learning Fundamentals
modules.description: Introduce core ML algorithms and techniques. Learners will build and evaluate models for predictive tasks.
learningObjectives: Implement supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms.
Evaluate model performance using metrics.
Tune hyperparameters for better accuracy.

topics.name: Supervised Learning
learningObjectives: Train regression and classification models.
Handle overfitting and underfitting.
Apply ensemble methods.

projects: Predict house prices using regression on Boston dataset.

topics.name: Unsupervised Learning
learningObjectives: Cluster data using K-means and hierarchical methods.
Perform dimensionality reduction with PCA.
Detect anomalies in datasets.

projects: Cluster iris dataset and visualize with PCA.

modules.name: Advanced AI and Deep Learning
modules.description: Dive into neural networks, NLP, and computer vision for AI engineering. Focus on building scalable AI systems.
learningObjectives: Design and train deep learning models.
Process text and images with AI techniques.
Integrate AI with big data tools.

topics.name: Deep Learning Basics
learningObjectives: Build feedforward and convolutional neural networks.
Use frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Optimize models with transfer learning.

projects: Classify images using CNN on MNIST dataset.

topics.name: Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Computer Vision
learningObjectives: Process text with tokenization and embeddings.
Build sentiment analysis and object detection models.
Apply transformers like BERT.

projects: Develop a chatbot using NLP techniques.

topics.name: Big Data and AI Integration
learningObjectives: Process large datasets with Spark.
Scale ML models using distributed computing.
Handle real-time data streams.

projects: Analyze a large dataset with Spark ML.

modules.name: Model Deployment, Ethics, and Capstone
modules.description: Learn to deploy models into production, address ethical issues, and apply all skills in a capstone project for portfolio building.
learningObjectives: Deploy AI models using cloud services.
Identify and mitigate biases in AI systems.
Integrate full pipeline from data to deployment.

topics.name: Model Deployment and MLOps
learningObjectives: Containerize models with Docker.
Deploy on cloud (e.g., AWS SageMaker).
Monitor and version models.

projects: Deploy a ML model as a web API.

topics.name: AI Ethics and Responsible AI
learningObjectives: Understand bias, fairness, and privacy in AI.
Implement ethical guidelines in projects.
Discuss societal impacts of AI.

projects: Audit a model for biases and propose fixes.

topics.name: Capstone Project
learningObjectives: Synthesize all modules in a real-world AI project.
Present findings and deploy a solution.
Build a portfolio entry.

subtopics.name: Project Development
subsubtopics: Problem selection (e.g., predictive maintenance, recommendation system)

projects: Develop and deploy an AI application (e.g., image classifier or NLP tool).

careerPreparation.resumeBuilding: Guidance on highlighting projects and skills.
careerPreparation.interviewPrep: Mock interviews, LeetCode-style problems, behavioral questions.

resources: Books: 'Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow' by Aurélien Géron.
Platforms: Coursera (Andrew Ng's ML course), Kaggle for datasets.
